misdeed: Terror grips a coastal community as their ships begin disappearing into the depths, dragged down by an unseen force. The few survivors speak of a colossal shape beneath the waves, its eyes glowing with an ancient, malevolent intelligence.
solution: The Vaesen is a Sea Serpent and can be destroyed by tricking it into biting its own tail, causing it to sink to the bottom of the sea and dissolve into sludge.

clues.description: The disappearances occur in an area known for its treacherous currents and unpredictable weather, but the survivors insist it was something far more sinister.
Fishermen report their nets being torn to shreds, pulled down by an immense weight, and coming up empty.
A single, barnacle-encrusted ship's figurehead washes ashore, its face contorted in a silent scream, its eyes scratched out as if by massive claws.
Local legends speak of a monstrous sea serpent, guardian of the deep, that demands respect and punishes those who dare to plunder its domain.
A cartographer discovers a series of ancient markings on a centuries-old map, indicating the presence of a submerged island chain and a warning to avoid the area at all costs.
A deep-sea diver, exploring the wreckage of a sunken ship, claims to have seen a colossal shape moving in the depths, its scales shimmering like moonlight on water.

plotTwist.description: A secretive group of smugglers, using the treacherous waters to hide their illicit cargo, has inadvertently angered the Vaesen by dumping their refuse into its territory.
